issues.summary: Auto select subscription option in plans page

comments.author: Beatrice Dimarucut
comments.body:
[~accountid:6110de8f0b454a00685dd333] Note: I noticed that if somebody is logged in and they go to Plans with a subscription voucher attached already, the discount banners don’t show up because OTP is selected by default

People only see the discount when they switch to subscription which is why it’s really important that we always auto-select subscription even if somebody chose OTP in the past

When testing for this let’s make sure that test:

* Subscription is selected automatically when click

comments.author: Romina Nicastro
comments.body:
I think we can add another Guard for a few different scenarios (apart from the login one), depending on what would be the expected flow. For instance:

* OTP customers and no subscription or no active subscription: they can access {{/one-time-deliveries}} page
* OTP customers and active subscription: redirect to dashboard? Or they can access to OTP dashboard?
* No OTP orders and subscription (active or cancelled): redirect to dashboard
* No OTP orders and no subscription: redirect to plans page

comments.author: Beatrice Dimarucut
comments.body:
Note to self: guards impact whether people can access the OTP Dashboard eg if they type the URL manually from their browser

Unlikely that someone who does _not_ have an OTP order would actually know/save the OTP Dashboard URL so not a must; more of an edge case since usually customers who click the good chop header will either stay on the funnel (logged out) or get redirected to My Deliveries with an active subscription

[Plans Page] - Yellow banner shouldn't show
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*
When customer comes from graduation component on OTP dashboard to plans page and otp is selected by default the blue banner doesn’t show. 
Instead, when the customer changes to subscribe and save, there’s this yellow banner (the assumption is that this is the same as shown for subscription customers when they’re logged in and apply a voucher) 

This banner doesn’t have discount information and it’s not possible to dismiss. For more information on the flow see video
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*AC*
Yellow banner doesn’t show for otp customers making a second purchase
Blue banner shows with the discount communication (this is already the case when the customer lands on plans page and subscribe and save is pre selected)

{panel}

issues.summary: Firefighter W02-03
Header entrypoint to /one-time-deliveries
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
h3. Description

The task requires adding a new header entry titled "One-time orders" which is displayed exclusively for customers who are logged in with an OTP (One-Time Purchase) order. The requirements for this feature are as follows:

* The "One-time box" header entry must be visible only when the user is logged in as an OTP customer.
* The header entry should include a link that navigates the user to the OTP dashboard page when clicked.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
h3. Acceptance Criteria

* “One-time box” header entry visible when logged in as an OTP customer only
* "One-time box" link navigates to OTP dashboard page

comments.author: Alexander Matlin
comments.body:
h1. Fix Statsig "No Values Checks" Health Issue for mr\_charge\_at\_checkout
h2. Status: IMPLEMENTED ✓
*Solution*: Added {{loadingStatus \!== 'Ready'}} check in {{app/libs/experimentation\-poc\-statsig/decide.ts}}

h2. Problem Summary
The {{mr\_charge\_at\_checkout}} experiment on Statsig shows a *"Group Assignment Health" WARNING*:
\- *23.08% of checks return "NoValues"* \- The SDK was initialized but didn't successfully get values
\- Exposure stream shows entries with {{Rule: Uninitialized}} a

comments.author: Alexander Matlin
comments.body:
Summary from [the thread|https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/CJ5NL6LEQ/p1768238605167189?thread_ts=1767000918.770079&cid=CJ5NL6LEQ] with the Experimentation Core team:

{quote}The core problem is that the experimentation SDK fails to load its configuration file in about 2% to 4% of initializations across all brands.

* *Cause:* The configuration file is too large, and certain landing pages (like the plans page) are optimized to load it asynchronously via the network, which can time out after 1

issues.summary: [Dashboard] - Fetch OTP orders in the new OTP dashboard page
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

In the OTP orders page {{app/pages/whitelabel/one-time-deliveries}} the endpoint from reactivation_bff is called on page render through the {{useOneTimeOrdersView}} hook. 

We will show a Header component containing a Title and Subtitle when data is available. 

!Screenshot 2025-12-03 at 20.24.13.png|width=376,height=81,alt="Screenshot 2025-12-03 at 20.24.13.png"!
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Tech details* 


Instead of directly fetching the orders from the root component {{OneTimeDeliveriesRoot}}, let’s create a new component called {{OneTimeOrdersPage}} that will be called from the root.

{noformat}/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/one-time-deliveries/
  ├── index.tsx                  # Root component with page guards
  └── OneTimeOrdersPage.tsx      # Main component with UI logic{noformat}

On mount in {{OneTimeOrdersPage}}, the request to fetch one-time orders can be triggered

POC branch[https://github.com/hellofresh/web/tree/feature%2FGOC-3059|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/tree/feature%2FGOC-3059|smart-link] 
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*AC*

# On page load, the OTP orders are fetched in {{OneTimeOrdersPage}} component
## Error and empty data are gracefully handled on OTP orders page
### On Error
### Empty Data
# When data is present, a Title and Subtitle is shown on OTP orders page
## *Title* : Your One-Time Orders
## *Subtitle :* See and track upcoming and past one-time orders

{panel}

comments.author: Madeeha Hasan
comments.body:
Checklist for Localize: 

□ Step 1: Create Google Sheet with translations (use "en")
□ Step 2: Submit Google Form (Tool = "Lokalize", Priority = Normal)
□ Step 3: Create PR adding keys to groups-kv.json
□ Step 4: Get PR approved by your team
□ Step 5: Merge PR
□ Step 6: Wait ~1 day for Lokalise sync
□ Step 7: Verify translations in app/translations/goodchop/en-US/one-time-orders.json
□ Step 8: Ship your feature!

links.summary: [Plan settings] Show graduation banner

issues.summary: [Funnel/Plans] Integrate OTP Banner logic and data fetching
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
h3. Description

Implement the business logic and data integration for the One-Time Purchase (OTP) banner component. This includes fetching user's upcoming OTP orders, determining when to show the banner, and handling the navigation to order details.

*Related UI Ticket:* GOC-3377 - [Funnel/Plans] Create OTP Banner/Entrypoint component

*Data Requirements:*

* Fetch user's upcoming one-time purchases using existing {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}} hook
* Determine if user has any upcoming OTP deliveries
* Get order details (order ID, delivery date, order status)
* Handle loading, error, and empty states

*Business Logic:*

* Show banner only if user has an upcoming OTP order
* Banner should appear on funnel/plans and checkout pages (Delivery page and Payment page)
* Handle click navigation to OTP dashboard page
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
h3. 🔧 Technical Implementation Details

*Existing Hook to Use:*

* *File:* {{app/data-access/customer-orders/one-time-orders.ts}}
* *Hook:* {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}}
* This hook already fetches the user's one-time orders - use this instead of creating new API calls

*Implementation Steps:*

# Import and use {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}} hook in the funnel/plans page component
# Pass the relevant order data as props to the OTP Banner UI component (from GOC-3377)
# Implement conditional rendering - only show banner if upcoming orders exist
# Ensure proper integration with UI component props from [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3377|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3377|smart-link]
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
h3. Acceptance Criteria

h3. ✅ AC1: Data Fetching & State Management

* Uses {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}} hook from {{app/data-access/customer-orders/one-time-orders.ts}} to fetch OTP orders
* Correctly identifies if user has upcoming one-time purchase
* Handles loading state while fetching data (shows loading indicator or hides banner)
* Handles error state if hook returns

issues.summary: Hide the payment banner for the C@C flow

comments.author: Alexander Matlin
comments.body:
h2. Clarifying Questions for Implementation Planning

Based on analysis of the codebase and the ticket requirements, I have the following questions:

*1. Which experiment determines banner visibility?*
The ticket references the {{mr_one_time_purchase_mvp}} Statsig experiment. I found two related experiments in the codebase:

* {{mr_one_time_purchase_mvp}} (used in plans flow, returns {{isControl}} boolean)
* {{mr_charge_at_checkout}} (used in payment page, returns {{shouldPerformCharge}})

Which

comments.body:
h1. Implementation Specification: Hide PaymentAnxietyBanner for C@C Flow

h2. Goal

Hide the {{PaymentAnxietyBanner}} component on the {{/checkout/payment}} page when a customer is allocated to the Charge at Checkout (C@C) experiment variation. This is a temporary experiment that may need to be rolled back.

h2. User Stories

* As a customer in the C@C experiment variation, I should not see the payment anxiety banner on the checkout payment page
* As a customer in the control group (BAU), I shou

issues.summary: [Dashboard] Graduation Component Display
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*
The graduation component will be shown on the OTP Dashboard for the following two scenarios,

# *As an OTP only customer* [Design|https://www.figma.com/design/c8UzNBNmx0cG7DVkJPhNal/GoC--SBD-2302----GoC-OTP-v2?node-id=10968-40857&m=dev&focus-id=10968-37863]
# *As an OTP + Subscription customer (graduated customer)* [Design|https://www.figma.com/design/c8UzNBNmx0cG7DVkJPhNal/GoC--SBD-2302----GoC-OTP-v2?node-id=11215-79800&m=dev&focus-id=10968-37863]

The scope of this ticket is to enhance the static component created in [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3214|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3214|smart-link] to,
##  contain an error boundary,
##  dynamic content driven from contentful,
## CTA redirections,
### *OTP only customer* → redirects to funnel /plans
### *OTP + Subscription* → redirects to /my-deliveries

{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria*

* Adds error boundary
* The benefits comes from contentful
* The CTA should,
** *OTP only customer* → redirects to funnel /plans
** *OTP + Subscription* → redirects to /my-deliveries
{panel}

issues.summary: [Checkout/Payment] Add Tracing to useCreateOTPCartForCheckout Hook
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Add comprehensive tracing to the {{useCreateOTPCartForCheckout}} hook to enable monitoring, debugging, and performance tracking of OTP cart creation during checkout. This will help identify issues in production and provide visibility into the OTP checkout flow.

*Background:*

* OTP cart creation is a new flow that needs observability
* Spans should capture key attributes, timing, and success/failure states
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Technical Notes*

*Create Span in createOTPCart Function:*

* Name span: {{'otp-checkout.create-cart'}} 

*Span Attributes to Capture:*

*Before API Call:*

* {{'product-handle'}} - The OTP product SKU
* {{'delivery-date'}} - Selected delivery date
* {{'delivery-option-handle'}} - Selected delivery option
* {{'product-count'}} - Number of unique products selected
* {{'total-quantity'}} - Total quantity of all products

*After API Call (Success):*

* {{'cart-uuid'}} - The returned cart UUID
* {{'cart-created'}} - true

*On Error:*

* {{'error-type'}} - Type of error (validation, API, etc.)
* {{'error-message'}} - Error message

*Span Status:*

* Success: {{SpanStatusCode.OK}} with message {{'OTP cart created successfully'}}
* Error: {{SpanStatusCode.ERROR}} with error message

*Follow Existing Patterns:*

* Reference {{useSavePreCheckoutProducts.ts}} (lines 56-71) for tracing pattern
* Reference {{useCreateOTPCart.ts}} in {{app/spaces/one-time-purchase}} for OTP-specific tracing
* Ensure span is ended even if errors occur (use try/finally)
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance criteria:*

* Span created at start of {{createOTPCart}} function
* Span named appropriately (e.g., {{'otp-checkout.create-cart'}})
* All required attributes set before API call
* Cart UUID captured in span after successful creation
* Error type and message captured on failure
* Tracing doesn't impact user experience (non-blocking)
* Traces are visible in Honeycomb
{panel}

comments.author: Himash Tehan
comments.body:
h2. Clarifying Questions for Implementation Planning
*Questions and Answers:*

# *Q:* Should we trace both POST \(create new cart\) and PATCH \(update existing cart\) operations with separate span names like 'otp\-checkout.create\-cart' and 'otp\-checkout.update\-cart', or a single span name with an attribute indicating the operation type?
*A:* Single span name
# *Q:* Should we capture the fallback scenario \(PATCH 404/403 \-> POST\) as a special case in tracing with an attribute like 'fallback\

issues.summary: Implement new attributes in reactivation-bff call
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Clients need to pass two new attributes to the request body of the reactivation-bff call {{reactivation-subscription/reactivate}}:

* {{cadence_start_week}}: should be retrieved from the {{nextModifiableDelvieryWeek}} value from the {{/customer/me/subscriptions}} response.
* {{cadence_interval}}: should be retrieved from the {{endlessPauseInterval}} value from the {{/customer/me/subscription}} response.

Customer impact:

* Cadence interval breaks on reactivation, when reactivation happens within a short period of time after cancellation - issue is reprodicible when reactivation happens on the same day, but it could be longer as well
* Customer is reactivated with a *weekly cadence*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*AC*

Ensure that these fields are correctly passed and handled in the reactivation process.
{panel}

_Issue created in Slack from a_ [_message_|https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C09MNFEH6VC/p1763020804905709?thread_ts=1761234939.380539&cid=C09MNFEH6VC]_._

issues.summary: [SubscriptionLoading] Create OTP Footer Component (Continue CTA)
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Create {{OTPFooter}} component by cloning the existing {{Footer.tsx}} and modifying it for OTP-specific behavior. This maintains consistency in styling and structure while adding OTP-specific redirect logic and reuse the same GTM event fired in the subscription flow ([per the thread|https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C0A3TV1MM5Z/p1767620709913509]).

*Background:*

* OTP footer needs same styling/structure as subscription footer
* Only differences: redirect destination and button state logic
* Cloning ensures visual consistency
* Easier to maintain common styling between both footer

!image-20251202-130556.png|width=1193,height=623,alt="image-20251202-130556.png"!
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Technical Notes*

*File to Create:* {{app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/my-deliveries-components/src/pages/loading-subscription-content/order-confirmation/OTPFooter.tsx}}

*Cleanup required*

# Add OTP-specific imports
# Remove subscription-specific logic
# Update redirectToDashboard function
# Update button props

{noformat}<Button.Primary
  onClick={redirectToOTPDashboard}
  disabled={false} // Changed - always enabled for OTP
  loading={false}  // Changed - never loading for OTP
  data-test-id="otp-order-confirmation-CTA" // Changed
>
  {label}
</Button.Primary>{noformat}
{panel}



{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance criteria:*

* OTPFooter.tsx created by copying Footer.tsx
* Subscription-specific imports removed (useQueryClient, useMenuRedirection, etc.)
* Button always enabled (disabled={false})
* Button never in loading state (loading={false})
* Redirects to /my-deliveries/otp
* Clears OTP flag on redirect
* Visual styling identical to original Footer
{panel}

issues.summary: [Payments] Hide "You won't get charged before..." message when OTP SKU is selected
Migrate Root.js from legacy code to modern React patterns
issues.description:
h2. Context
The {{Root.js}} file in the checkout flow is currently implemented as a class component using legacy Redux patterns. This makes it difficult to:
* Use modern React hooks
* Integrate with newer data-access patterns
* Maintain and test the component
* Apply modern best practices

h2. Current State
* *File*: {{app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/libraries/store/src/checkout/Root.js}}
* *Implementation*: Class component with {{mapStateToProps}} and {{mapDispatchToProps}}
* *Redux*: Uses legacy Redux selectors and actions
* *Hooks*: Cannot use modern hooks like {{useGetCustomerSubscriptions}}, {{useHasOTPInCart}}, etc.

h2. Proposed Changes
1. *Convert to Functional Component*: Migrate from class component to functional component
2. *Modernize Data Fetching*: Replace Redux selectors with {{@/data-access}} hooks where applicable
3. *Use Modern Hooks*: Leverage React hooks for state management and side effects
4. *Improve Type Safety*: Add proper TypeScript types (convert from {{.js}} to {{.tsx}})
5. *Simplify Logic*: Refactor complex lifecycle methods into cleaner {{useEffect}} hooks

h2. Benefits
* Easier to maintain and extend
* Better integration with modern patterns used in other guards (e.g., {{FactorFormCheckoutGuard.tsx}})
* Improved type safety
* More testable code
* Consistent with current development standards

h2. Related Work
* This migration was identified during the implementation of GOC-3427 (OTP checkout fix)
* The current implementation works but uses patterns that are being phased out

h2. Acceptance Criteria
* [ ] {{Root.js}} is converted to a functional component ({{Root.tsx}})
* [ ] All class lifecycle methods are replaced with appropriate hooks
* [ ] Redux selectors are replaced with modern data-access hooks where possible
* [ ] Component maintains all existing functionality
* [ ] All existing tests pass
* [ ] New tests are added for any refactored logic
* [ ] No regressions in checkout flow

comments.author: Himash Tehan
comments.body:
*Clarifying Questions*

# *Cleanup timing: Should the cleanup happen in the onCheckoutSuccessMinimal function (around line 735-777 in Payment.js) right after the order is successfully created and before navigating away? Or should it happen at a different point in the flow?*
Yes, the cleanup happen in the onCheckoutSuccessMinimal function (around line 735-777 in Payment.js) right after the order is successfully created and before navigating away

# *Cleanup method: Should we use the Jotai atoms

comments.author: Himash Tehan
comments.body:
h2. Clarifying Questions for Implementation Planning
Thank you for providing the answers\! Here's a summary of the clarified requirements:

*1. Cleanup Timing*
\- ✅ Cleanup should happen in {{onCheckoutSuccessMinimal}} function \(lines 735\-777 in Payment.js\)
\- Timing: Right after order is successfully created and before navigating away

*2. Cleanup Method*
\- ✅ Use {{setShippingAddressId\(null\)}} and {{setBillingAddressId\(null\)}} via Jotai atoms
\- This should be sufficient without direct

comments.author: Himash Tehan
comments.body:
h2. 📋 Implementation Specification
h1. Specification: Cleanup localStorage Keys After Successful OTP Order
h2. Goal
Prevent stale localStorage data from persisting after successful One\-Time Purchase \(OTP\) order creation by clearing the {{wl\-shipping\-address\-id}} and {{wl\-billing\-address\-id}} keys. This ensures that address IDs from previous orders don't cause issues with subsequent orders, particularly when the customer ID changes.

h2. User Stories
* As a system, I want to clear stored

issues.summary: [Runbook] Create reactivation 4xx and 5xx runbook
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Runbooks should contain the steps to follow to solve an alert/incident when triggered. It should give the firefighter/on-call person enough context and the tools to investigate a potential issue affecting our journey's critical paths.

When writing the runbook, envision a new team member whose responsibility is to investigate and resolve the issue. Provide them with sufficient context and resources. Include details that may seem obvious to you, as they can be invaluable to other team members.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
Add a runbook on [https://github.com/hellofresh/runbooks/blob/master/troubleshooting/new-brands/good-chop|https://github.com/hellofresh/runbooks/blob/master/troubleshooting/new-brands/good-chop] for the alerts:

* [Reactivation 4xx errors|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/triggers/DAugQkpW26J]
* [Reactivation 5xx errors|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/triggers/uoWETXyXqNu]

Include

* How to save an reactivate on staging and live  
* HC queries that could help debug the issue on the FE
* Loki queries that could help debug the issue on the BE 
* How to find the owners of the endpoint
* How to find a faulty PR on web repo (some HC queries)
{panel}

issues.summary: Plan size does not correctly update in Plan Settings
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Steps to replicate:

# Log in to existing account
# Go to plan settings
# Change plan (eg from M to L) 
# Go back to Dashboard and see that plan size did not upgrade

The success banner shows up on plan settings even though Dashboard & meal selection still shows the old plan

The SKU however seems to update correctly since:

* Update email shows new SKU
* going on Bob/OWL shows new SKU
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
When somebody updates their plan via Plan Settings, dashboard & meal selection should reflect new plan’s cuts
{panel}

comments.author: Matheus Bolognini
comments.body:
By doing a quick check, it seems that by changing the plan on settings page, the subscription is modified but the deliveries SKUs stays as they were, which leads to an assumption that this might be related to the [meal-selection-service|https://github.com/hellofresh/meal-selection-service] (the service that we migrated to some weeks ago).

Either something is not correctly working on the service (maybe it should reset the selection) or when changing the subscription we need to also change the me

comments.author: Beatrice Dimarucut
comments.body:
Recording on Live - findings:

* Dashboard doesn’t change - it keeps old number of cuts and old selection
* If I change eg from M (6 cuts) to L (12) and then only end up saving 7 cuts, I can still do this and it persists. However if I remove all cuts within meal selection, then the new number of cuts according to the new Plan will be enforced (X of 12 selected)

!Screen Recording 2025-12-23 at 17.11.03.mov|width=2880,height=1800,alt="Screen Recording 2025-12-23 at 17.11.03.mov"!
